description: A true French classic: the Palmier, or as some like to call it, 'the heart of France'.
ingredient: [{"name": "all-butter puff pastry", "units": "g", "amount": 250}, {"name": "caster sugar", "units": "g", "amount": 100}, {"name": "extra sugar for sprinkling", "units": null, "amount": null}]
step_by_step: 1. Preheat your oven to 240°C (465°F) and line a baking tray with baking parchment. 2. Unroll the puff pastry and scatter half the sugar over it, pressing it in with a rolling pin. 3. Flip the pastry, sprinkle the rest of the sugar, and press it in again. 4. Fold the pastry from both long edges towards the center, then fold again to create a long rectangle. 5. Slice the pastry into pieces about 2 cm thick. 6. Arrange on the tray and bake for 10-12 minutes, turning halfway if necessary.
notes: Palmiers can burn fast at this temperature, so watch closely. Best eaten on the day they are made.
